page.title: 03Essex NE coast recreation
page.content: There is scope for some recreation in the area, especially among the owners of any small craft - yauchts, dinghies and canoes. These use the safe anchorage of the Walton Channel during the summer months. Stone Marsh itself has a sandy beach which is used for camping, barbecues and picnics. Stone Marsh Island has two other rather interesting connections. Firstly there is a historical one. Spearhead-shaped flints have been discovered, pointing to the possibility of a Stone Age settlement there. Hence the name. The other connection is a leterary one. In the "Secret Water" by Arthur Ransome Stone Marsh was called Flint Island, reminding us again of the historical aspect. This area is a fascinating one for all nature lovers as well as lovers of the sea.
